name: Green Man Festival
description: Green Man isn't just a music festival; it's a temporary escape into a world of art, science, and Welsh folklore nestled in the stunning Brecon Beacons. Dedicated areas for children and families make it a perfect family adventure.

name: Hay Festival
description: The world-famous literary festival offering a huge programme for children and families, dubbed 'Haydays', featuring authors, workshops, and creative activities.

name: Royal Welsh Agricultural Show
description: The pinnacle of the British agricultural calendar. A massive four-day event showcasing Welsh livestock, food, and rural life. Huge amounts of entertainment for kids and families.

name: Wales Airshow
description: A spectacular two-day aerial extravaganza over Swansea Bay. Watch the Red Arrows and other displays from the beach. Completely free to attend.

name: National Eisteddfod
description: A celebration of Welsh culture, language, and arts. The 'Maes' offers a family-friendly environment with plenty of activities for children, music, and food.

name: Llangollen International Musical Eisteddfod
description: Each year around 4,000 performers from across the globe head to the small Welsh town of Llangollen. A colorful, vibrant family-friendly festival promoting peace and goodwill.

name: The Good Life Society Summer Camp
description: Intimate, boutique gatherings focused on the great outdoors, craft, music, and food. Very family-oriented with a focus on nature connection.

name: Cardiff Bay Water Festival
description: A multi-sport event featuring open water swimming, SUP races, and kayaking. Families are welcome to enjoy the festival atmosphere and shorter courses.

name: Snowdonia Walking Festival
description: Guided walks for all abilities, including family-friendly rambles, to explore the stunning trails of Snowdonia National Park.

name: Pembrokeshire Coast Path Festival
description: Guided walks, workshops, and talks celebrating the coast path. Includes family-friendly walks suitable for children.

name: Winter Walk at Dyffryn Gardens
description: A quiet winter walk is a great way to look after your body and mind. Explore the gardens and see the winter blooms.

name: Junior Parkrun at Plas Newydd
description: A free, fun, and friendly weekly 2k event for juniors (4 to 14 year olds). Held every Sunday morning.

name: Stackpole Striders
description: Join us for a free run or walk with amazing views of the landscape. Suitable for all abilities.

name: Coffee Morning at Stackpole Centre
description: Join us for an informative coffee morning at Stackpole centre to learn more about the estate and our work.

name: February Half Term Trails at Bodnant Garden
description: Family-friendly trails and activities are often held during the February half term. Check the specific venue website for the latest details on what's on.

name: Easter Holiday Activities at Bodnant Garden
description: Celebrate Easter with seasonal activities. Many venues host egg hunts, spring trails, and family crafts during the school holidays.

name: Summer Holiday Adventures at Bodnant Garden
description: Make the most of the summer break with outdoor family fun. Expect nature trails, games, and special events running throughout the summer holidays.

name: Halloween and Autumn Trails at Bodnant Garden
description: Spooky trails and autumn adventures are a staple at this time of year. Discover fungi, pumpkins, and seasonal stories.

name: Festive Season Events at Bodnant Garden
description: Enjoy the magic of the season with festive decorations, winter walks, and holiday-themed activities.
